result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth T Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, plus costs, and disbursements.  To be paid from monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.   Balances to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

09-23-15/ Stephanie G Rothstein
The Court ordered the JO C shall be amended to state that the defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  The defendant is ineligible to participate in these programs because of his conviction under Chapter 940, Stats. See 973.01(3g) & (3m), Stats.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
No contact with any gangs or be involved in gang activity. No contact with Marquis L., Takeyra J. or Tiora W. either directly or by third parties.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Underg a mental health evaluation. Follow any treatment recommended.

Continued no contact with Marquis L., Takeyra J. or Tiora W. personally or by third party contact.
No gang involvement or activity.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician.
No alcohol.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample ordered in 15CF395.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised of voting ineligibility.

Per order dated October 14, 2021, Appeal No. 2015XX1459-CR (2015CF395, 2015CF400 and 2015CF2411), IT IS ORDERED that the motions filed by Attorney Tempska to reinstate and extend Lewis's appellate deadlines are denied.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion filed by Attorney Muller to extend Lewis's appellate deadlines is denied.
Letter from Attorney Nicole Muller asking the court to stay a decision on Attorney Tempska's motion to withdraw as counsel pending litigation in the Court of Appeals.
State Public Defender Report
Motion to Withdraw as Appointed Postconviction Counsel
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. mag

Per order dated October 1, 2021, Appeal No. 2015XX1459-CR (2015CF395, 2015CF400, 2015CF2411), IT IS ORDERED that the motion to withdraw filed by Attorney Tempska is denied without prejudice.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, within fifteen days after the date of this order, the State shall file a response to the motion to reinstate and extend appellate deadlines filed by Attorney Tempska on September 24, 2021.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion filed by Attorney Muller is held in abeyance pending further order of this court.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Defendant is to be sentenced on his case 15CF400; parties attempting a global resolution.  Should this case resolve, parties request to be heard on the next date with defendant's lower-pending case.  So ordered by the Court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #15CF400 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Lori Kowalefski-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  This case is reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to pending cases.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment.  Defense objects.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, defendant in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel Epps did not appear.  Attorney Epps contacted Court at approximately 4:30 to inform the Court that he was in a Sentencing Hearing in Branch 21, Judge Brash.  State did have witness(s) present.  Due to time of day, case will not be able to be commenced in a timely manner.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Kenyetta K; Tiora W; Marquis L; Takeyra J and co-defendant Brandon Newsom.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  
Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA has NOT been obtained from the Defendant. 
Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriffs  Department to obtain DNA from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
